title: Demanding Support for Trump, Justice Dept. Struggles to Recruit Prosecutors
summary: Some offices are so decimated that the Justice Department has sent in military lawyers. More recently, officials asked for volunteers from other offices who can quickly deploy to places in desperate need.

title: Talks on Immigration Enforcement Still Stuck as DHS Funding Deadline Nears
summary: Democrats’ demands include that immigration officers be required to show visible identification and have judicial warrants when they enter private property to make arrests.

title: Venezuela Frees Key Opposition Figures as Government Courts U.S. Support
summary: Hours after the release of at least 35 political prisoners, the most prominent one was “kidnapped” by armed men, according to relatives.

title: Bad Bunny Delivers a Joyful Halftime Show
summary: The Puerto Rican musician celebrated Latino heritage and performed mostly in Spanish in a show that had become a political flashpoint amid his criticism of ICE.

title: The 2026 Super Bowl Ads, Ranked
summary: Here is our critic’s survey of this year’s Super Bowl commercials, from best to worst to A.I.

title: Epstein Files Reveal Scope of Ghislaine Maxwell’s Role in Clinton Circle
summary: Jeffrey Epstein’s longtime companion helped advise on the kickoff of the Clinton Global Initiative and arranged for $1 million in funding for it, emails show.

title: Starmer’s Chief of Staff Resigns, Citing Role in Hiring Friend of Epstein
summary: The Labour official was ensnared in a scandal after helping appoint Peter Mandelson as Britain’s ambassador to the U.S.

title: 7 Days, No Suspects: The Disappearance of Nancy Guthrie
summary: The mother of the “Today” show host Savannah Guthrie has not been heard from since an evening of dinner and games with family members.

title: Extreme Cold Persists in the Northeast With Record-Setting Temperatures
summary: Punishing winds have combined with low temperatures to produce dangerously cold conditions across the Northeast. Forecasters say, though, that relief is on the horizon.

title: Cold Deaths in New York Climb to 18 as Frigid Winds Linger
summary: A person was found dead in the Bronx on Saturday morning, the police said. An 81-year-old man was also found dead on a rooftop, though it was unclear whether the cold was to blame.

title: Japan’s Sanae Takaichi Wins Snap Election in a Landslide
summary: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi won a sweeping mandate from voters for her economic agenda and tough stances on immigration and China.

title: Japan Stocks Surge on Takaichi’s Landslide Election Win
summary: Stocks climbed on Monday as investors cheered a result seen as a mandate for the prime minister’s high-spending economic agenda.

title: Jimmy Lai’s 20-Year Term Follows a Familiar Chinese Pattern
summary: The heavy sentence for the Hong Kong publisher aligns with mainland cases where influential critics of the Communist Party have been sent to prison for many years.

title: These A.I. Dreamers Don’t Fit the Stereotype
summary: Young tech entrepreneurs in San Francisco are hoping to cash in, even as they wonder how artificial intelligence will affect society.

title: Feeling ‘Amateur’ at Retirement Planning, They Asked A.I. for Help
summary: More people are turning to chatbots for advice, inquiring about high-stakes decisions such as saving for retirement — even if they eventually turn to a human.

title: After M23 Takeover, Goma Carries Violent Memories and Signs of Hope
summary: A year after a rebel takeover, residents of Goma, in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, carry violent memories and signs of hope.

title: ‘You Cannot Feel Remotely Sorry for the Patriots’: Opinion Writers Tackle the Super Bowl
summary: Super Bowl LX is in the books. An Opinion round table breaks down the game, the entertainment — and the commercials.

title: Death, Undocumented
summary: A decade or so after the peak of Europe’s migrant crisis, one of the busiest and deadliest entry points to the continent has devolved from crisis to something more chronic.

title: Portugal Elects a President, With Leftist Beating a Surging Far Right
summary: Despite a decisive victory for António José Seguro, a nationalist’s presence in the runoff showed that Portugal is not immune to Europe’s rising far-right tide.

title: 4 Dead in Mushroom Poisoning Outbreak in California
summary: State health officials discouraged foraging this year, saying that toxic mushrooms can easily be confused with safe ones to eat.

title: Five Years After Myanmar Coup, ‘Even Hope Has Become a Risk’
summary: The country’s cities have been spared the violence of a hard-fought civil war. But as the economy has hollowed out, many urbanites have become desperate.

title: Iranian Nobel Laureate Gets Second Prison Sentence and Ends Hunger Strike
summary: The activist Narges Mohammadi was sentenced to another seven years, bringing the total she must serve to 17 years, her foundation said.
